name: South Pacific Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night beginning of June. I had a double room for single occupancy for £40. My room was on the 18th floor. It was nice enough, The room was large enough for one, the bathroom a tad bit small, when standing in the bath, my head barely cleared the ceiling. The bedding was clean and there were adequate toiletries. There was a mini bar and a TV in the room with english channels. The staff were okay, checked me in and out in a timely fashion.The location was about 5 minutes to Times Square where you can then connect to the MTR Causeway Bay station but thats another 5 minute walk in itself with so many people to navigate thru. Overall a sane hotel which seem to have various on site facilities such as a business centre restaurants gym etc but as I was only there for a day, i was unable to thoroughly explore it.
reviews.title: Did the business

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed 3 nights here at the end of April while visiting extended family in Hong Kong. My uncle, a local travel agent, recommended this hotel as a reasonably priced hotel that was conveniently located.
reviews.title: Clean & convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: We were satisfied with our choice, though not terribly impressed. The room was small, really barely fitting two twin beds, a desk, and a night table, leaving very little room to walk around, or to store our large suitcase. The cleaning staff was friendly, and attentive. (we had to call them right away to move the twin beds together to make the 'king size' bed we'd been promised on check-in - they came within 5 mins) The bathroom was clean, but did not have a hairdryer (you have to call the front desk for one). Our view was of the back of the next building - not very pretty.
reviews.title: A decent hotel in Wanchai District, H.K.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is close to central, about a 10-12 minute walk to the MTR, and a 5 min walk to the trolleys. Times Square is a huge shopping center, with a large food court, which is only 5-10 minutes away (current street construction makes the way difficult to find though).
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: The most convenient part of the hotel is the airport shuttle you can book from the lobby. It's about $20 one way and drops you off directly at your terminal.
reviews.title: Good:above average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here with my fiancee for Eight nights. Times Square is about 3 minutes walk with fantastic shopping and the MTR to access all of Hong Kong. Bars, restaurants and lovely little side street outside hotel with fresh seafood chinese local eateries and a daily market that bristles with colour and local tradition.
reviews.title: Times Square Hotel.

likes.liked: — Felt like Home when we got to our room at the end of each day. Safe and peaceful.
likes.disliked: — The bed, the bed and oh yes, the bed. Fred Flintstone would have complained too!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms: Upgrade to Deluxe overlooking Happy Valley racecourse. Cosy room, clean, very warm feel. Bathroom clean, ok size, modern. Well soundproofed. Mattress felt like a slab of marble my only critizism! Room maids are fantastic.
reviews.title: Loved the top floor lounge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Amenities: Great little Gymn. Starlight Piano lounge top floor with singers and a bar although I didn`t use it. Two internet terminals a bit pricey but cheap internet just across the road. Great breakfast room, really classy and a restaurant downstairs.
reviews.title: Reasonable... but very 3 star

likes.liked: — The location and easy transport close by

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: Overall it is a modern hotel, very clean, helpful staff and fantastic position on Hong Kong Island at a reasonable rate.
reviews.title: Very Convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for 8 nights in March. We loved the location. Walking past the fresh fish shops and the very basic local cafes on the way to the underground was a great experience. The room was small but we only sleep in hotel rooms so we don't care. We found a very cheap website (£300 for 8 nights) and I suspect your allocated floor/room size depends on how much you pay. The one big plus for us was the top floor lounge. Table service by very nice and efficient staff (the first night I gave a waitress HK$40 tip and she said it was too much and gave me 20 back!) Entertainment from a very good trio and excellent views as it's 28 floor up and all glass. We never got in at night until 10.30pm at the earliest, so the lounge was a nice place to go to unwind and was open till 1am. We would return to this hotel for this amenity alone. I didn't see children in the lounge (or even in the hotel - but we were hardly in long enough to notice) Photos are fuzzy due to poor light.
reviews.title: Best Deal in Hong Kong

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: We (my wife and adult son) have stayed in this property on two occassions for one week on each stay. Both stays were in the trade fair peak season and as expected, the rates weren't exactly cheap anywhere in Hong Kong.
reviews.title: The Best Kept Secret in Hong Kong

likes.liked: — Value for money, great staff, reasonable location
likes.disliked: — Small and basic (but spotless) standard rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: On our first stay, we took an Executive Studio which is basically two standard rooms with a sliding glass divider in between. Our son slept on the pull-out sofa bed which was comfortable enough for a 120 kg heavy weight. We were on the 22nd floor and had a refreshing view of Happy Valley thru the large picture windows. The decor and amenities of the Executive Studio is on a par with the more expensive Park Lane and Excelsior in Causeway and it's only five minutes longer in walking distance to MTR station and the centre of Causeway Bay.
reviews.title: Family friendly too!

likes.disliked: — some staff cannot understand our inquiries

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Internet wi-fi access (we didn't find an ethenet socket in the room) was complimentary in the Executive Studio but it's only good for one laptop. Apparently the server records your MAC address on first log-in and the same log-in could not be used for a second lap top and we had to purchase a 7-day pass for about A$50 - not that bad by Asian standards for the second laptop.
reviews.title: Pros outweigh the cons

likes.liked: — Free drinks and internet access in Executive Lounge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: It was nice to be able to enjoy a free quick light breakfast and coffee in the Executive Lounge with a sweeping view of the surrounding area in the morning and free snacks and coctails in the evening.
reviews.title: Not good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled solo
reviews.text: On our second stay, we decided to take two standard room for the same price as one Executive Studio to give our adult son some privacy. We were given two ajoining rooms in the high teens and still had a pleasant outlook. However the decore (tired) and bathroom amenities (very basic) were so different to the Executive Studio that we thought we had booked into a different hotel! Each individual standard room at about 20 sq metres, is also a bit cramped. Nevertheless, the standard rooms were spotless and housekeeping standards were just as high as the Executive Studio. Internet was not free in the standard rooms but the charge was still reasonable at A$50 for 7 days. We missed the Executive Lounge privilages.
reviews.title: Clean; good value; safe location - BUT small rooms
Good Location, Enjoyable Stay.
reviews.text: Rooms were clean, bright and cosy. Perfect for a couple who want a nice end of day home from home. Higher floors are more peaceful as less traffic noise. Hotel reception was always helpful in answering questions and booking tours. Location is next to Times Square (3 minute walk) and all shops and restaurants and MTR rail link. Hotel cuisine is excellent (a little bit expensive) and they have two internet pay terminals. Great Location, informative staff, a good honest hotel at a reasonable room rate.

reviews.title: Clean, good value, great breakfast, decent location
reviews.text: We ended up here because we waited too long to book and the whole city was booked up for an electronics conference. But, we got a good rate online through a last-minute website. Our room was very clean and didn't smell -- tough to find affordably in HK, I believe. Good location (5-7 mins walk from subway). Very helpful staff. They have a complimentary shuttle service to/from the airport express train. Yummy breakfast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the South Pacific in November 2006 for four nights. The hotel is situated on Hong Kong Island in an area where the Chinese workers live. Although not particularly a tourist area we found it facinating visiting street markets and such. The hotel was being renovated when we stayed there and to be fair it needed updating. The rooms were clean and about average for a three star hotel. We ate once in the hotel and found it to be a little more expensive than comparable nearby restaurants but the quality was good. The top floor of the hotel is the starlight lounge and overlooks Happy Valley Racecourse. We found it an ideal place for a night cap and to look out over the island.
reviews.title: Great Position

likes.disliked: — A little tired but it is being updated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2006
reviews.text: Getting to the hotel - use the airport express train - its excellent - and there are a numerous taxis available on your arrival at Hong Kong rail station. Hong Kong is the last stop of four on the track and, on your return, you can check your baggage at the railway station for your next flight - a brilliant idea!
reviews.title: Jan 2007 - Beware of the Renovations!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: Our favourite day out was to the Po Lin Buddha on Lan Tau Island. The organised trips would have cost about £120 each but the MTR (about £10 for as many trips in a day as you want to take) stops at the skyrail (£20 for 2) that takes you to the buddha.
reviews.title: Aweful, decrepit, puny, smelly, damp, mouldy. Hideous!!! Yuk!!!

likes.liked: — The doorman and the bellhops were very nice.
likes.disliked: — The rooms were mouldy, damp and smelly.

reviews.title: Fantastic price for a sweet suite!
reviews.text: Overall, hotels in Hong Kong tend to be very expensive, and this hotel was reasonably priced, clean, and in a safe, convenient area, and that is all we needed. It was on par to a nicer Holiday Inn in the U.S.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at the South Pacific not knowing fully what to expect. We had booked on a budget and it was our first time to Hong Kong.
reviews.title: Reasonable stay

likes.disliked: — The staff COULD very easily have been more friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were reasonable, not overfriendly but not discourteous. The rooms were small but I liked them because of this, it gave a cosy contrast to Hong Kong’s cold damp spring weather.
reviews.title: Don't expect too much

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: The positioning of the hotel could have been better, we used the underground system for the duration of our stay and it was a good ten-minute walk to the nearest station. It’s also handy that the structure is so noticeable, especially when we attempted to find our way home at night after a couple of drinks...
reviews.title: nice rooms

likes.disliked: — i wish the rooms were bigger

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Moral of the review, if your young and adventurous and the hotel you stay in isn’t going to make nor break your trip then this is a good mid range choice.
reviews.title: Happy with the choice of hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The South Pacific Hotel is on Hongkong Island, some blocks away from the main road. The building has 28 floors and 276 rooms and it seems to be in a rather good condition in contrast to its surrounding. You can find lots of stop-over-tourists as well as businessmen there.
reviews.title: Will go back!

likes.liked: — clean room, close to subway, restaurants, shopping
likes.disliked: — too much marble in the lobby

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had 5 nights in Hong Kong and wanted somewhere central and reasonably cheap. I looked for a long time on Trip Advisor reading all the reviews and seeing how the hotels were ranked. I finally took the plunge with South Pacific being persuaded by the very reasonably priced suites.
reviews.title: A lovely surprise!

likes.disliked: — Not much to dislike but slight cigarette smell

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived very early and luckily were able to check straight into our room which was lovely, everything you could want, huge bed, sofa, lovely bathroom with huge bath and rain shower (and heated toilet seat!!). The weather wasn't great and obscured the view slightly but still ok. We had access to the executive lounge where you get a free drink in the evening and also have the continental breakfast in the morning.
reviews.title: Great Location in the Diamond District

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were all extremely pleasant and helpful.
reviews.title: Did the deed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was great, 5 minutes from Causeway Bay MTR station, that is if you don't get distracted by the shops on the way!!
reviews.title: Nice hotel but away from main attractions

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Overall a very nice hotel and quite underrated. Can't comment on the normal rooms, but splash out on a suit, great value!!
reviews.title: Not bad at all - for the price

description: Distinctive 28-story Cylindrical Tower Hotel located on the island in the heart of Wanchai.
